name: avg
description: Returns the average of a set of `INTEGER`, `FLOAT` or `DURATION` values
examples:
UNWIND [duration('P2DT3H'), duration('PT1H45S')] AS dur
RETURN avg(dur)

name: collect
description: Returns a list containing the values returned by an expression

name: count
description: Returns the number of values or rows
examples:
MATCH (p:Person {name: 'Keanu Reeves'})-->(x)
RETURN labels(p), p.age, count(*)

MATCH (p:Person)-->(friend:Person)-->(friendOfFriend:Person)
WHERE p.name = 'Keanu Reeves'
RETURN friendOfFriend.name, count(friendOfFriend), count(ALL friendOfFriend), count(DISTINCT friendOfFriend)

name: max
description: Returns the maximum value in a set of values
examples:
UNWIND [1, 'a', null, 0.2, 'b', '1', '99'] AS val
RETURN max(val)

name: min
description: Returns the minimum value in a set of values
examples:
UNWIND [1, 'a', null, 0.2, 'b', '1', '99'] AS val
RETURN min(val)

name: percentileCont
description: Returns the percentile of a value over a group using linear interpolation

name: percentileDisc
description: Returns the nearest `INTEGER` or `FLOAT` value to the given percentile over a group using a rounding method

name: stDev
description: Returns the standard deviation for the given value over a group for a sample of a population
examples:
MATCH (p:Person)
WHERE p.name IN ['Keanu Reeves', 'Liam Neeson', 'Carrie Anne Moss']
RETURN stDev(p.age)

name: stDevP
description: Returns the standard deviation for the given value over a group for an entire population
examples:
MATCH (p:Person)
WHERE p.name IN ['Keanu Reeves', 'Liam Neeson', 'Carrie Anne Moss']
RETURN stDevP(p.age)

name: sum
description: Returns the sum of a set of `INTEGER`, `FLOAT` or `DURATION` values
examples:
UNWIND [duration('P2DT3H'), duration('PT1H45S')] AS dur
RETURN sum(dur)

name: db.nameFromElementId
description: Resolves the database name for the given element id
examples:
WITH "2:efc7577d-022a-107c-a736-dbcdfc189c03:0" AS eid
RETURN db.nameFromElementId(eid) AS name

name: graph.names
description: Lists the names of graphs in the current database

name: graph.propertiesByName
description: Returns the `MAP` of properties associated with a graph
examples:
UNWIND graph.names() AS name
RETURN name, graph.propertiesByName(name) AS props

UNWIND graph.names() AS name
WITH name, graph.propertiesByName(name) AS props
WHERE "A" IN props.tags
CALL () {
  USE graph.byName(name)
  MATCH (n)
  RETURN n
}
RETURN n

name: graph.byName
description: Returns the graph reference of the given name
examples:
UNWIND graph.names() AS graphName
CALL () {
  USE graph.byName(graphName)
  MATCH (n)
  RETURN n
}
RETURN n

name: graph.byElementId
description: Returns the graph reference with the given element id

name: coll.distinct
description: Returns the given list with all duplicate values removed
examples: RETURN coll.distinct([1, true, true, null, 'a', false, true, 1, null])

name: coll.flatten
description: Returns a list flattened to the given nesting depth

name: coll.indexOf
description: Returns the index of the first match of a value in the given list or -1 if the value is not present

name: coll.insert
description: Returns a list with the given value inserted at the given index

name: coll.max
description: Returns the largest value present in the given list

name: coll.min
description: Returns the smallest value present in the given list

name: coll.remove
description: Returns a list with the value at the given index removed

name: coll.sort
description: Returns a sorted list

name: keys
description: Returns a `LIST<STRING>` containing the `STRING` representations for all the property names of a `NODE`, `RELATIONSHIP` or `MAP`

name: labels
description: Returns a `LIST<STRING>` containing the `STRING` representations for all the labels of a `NODE`

name: nodes
description: Returns a `LIST<NODE>` containing all the `NODE` values in a `PATH`
examples:
MATCH p = (a)-->(b)-->(c)
WHERE a.name = 'Alice' AND c.name = 'Eskil'
RETURN nodes(p)

name: range
description: Returns a `LIST<INTEGER>` comprising all `INTEGER` values within a specified range created with step length, optionally specifying a step length

name: reduce
description: Runs an expression against individual elements of a `LIST<ANY>`, storing the result of the expression in an accumulator
signature: reduce(accumulator = initial, variable IN list \| expression)
examples:
MATCH p = (a)-->(b)-->(c)
WHERE a.name = 'Alice' AND b.name = 'Bob' AND c.name = 'Daniel'
RETURN reduce(totalAge = 0, n IN nodes(p) | totalAge + n.age) AS reduction

name: relationships
description: Returns a `LIST<RELATIONSHIP>` containing all the `RELATIONSHIP` values in a `PATH`
examples:
MATCH p = (a)-->(b)-->(c)
WHERE a.name = 'Alice' AND c.name = 'Eskil'
RETURN relationships(p)

name: reverse
description: Returns a `STRING` or `LIST<ANY>` in which the order of all characters or elements in the given `STRING` or `LIST<ANY>` have been reversed
examples:
WITH [4923,'abc',521, null, 487] AS ids
RETURN reverse(ids)

name: tail
description: Returns all but the first element in a `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH (a) WHERE a.name = 'Eskil'
RETURN a.likedColors, tail(a.likedColors)

name: toBooleanList
description: Converts a `LIST<ANY>` of values to a `LIST<BOOLEAN>` values. If any values are not convertible to `BOOLEAN` they will be null in the `LIST<BOOLEAN>` returned
examples:
RETURN toBooleanList(null) as noList,
toBooleanList([null, null]) as nullsInList,
toBooleanList(['a string', true, 'false', null, ['A','B']]) as mixedList

name: toFloatList
description: Converts a `LIST<ANY>` or a `VECTOR` to a `LIST<FLOAT>` values. If any values are not convertible to `FLOAT` they will be null in the `LIST<FLOAT>` returned
examples:
RETURN toFloatList(null) as noList,
toFloatList([null, null]) as nullsInList,
toFloatList(['a string', 2.5, '3.14159', null, ['A','B']]) as mixedList

name: toIntegerList
description: Converts a `LIST<ANY>` or a `VECTOR` to a `LIST<INTEGER>` values. If any values are not convertible to `INTEGER` they will be null in the `LIST<INTEGER>` returned
examples:
RETURN toIntegerList(null) as noList,
toIntegerList([null, null]) as nullsInList,
toIntegerList(['a string', 2, '5', null, ['A','B']]) as mixedList

name: toStringList
description: Converts a `LIST<ANY>` to a `LIST<STRING>` values. If any values are not convertible to `STRING` they will be null in the `LIST<STRING>` returned
examples:
RETURN toStringList(null) as noList,
toStringList([null, null]) as nullsInList,
toStringList(['already a string', 2, date({year:1955, month:11, day:5}), null, ['A','B']]) as mixedList

name: linenumber
description: Returns the line number that LOAD CSV is currently using

name: file
description: Returns the absolute path of the file that LOAD CSV is using

name: e
description: Returns the base of the natural logarithm, e

name: exp
description: Returns e^n, where e is the base of the natural logarithm, and n is the value of the argument expression

name: log
description: Returns the natural logarithm of a `FLOAT`

name: log10
description: Returns the common logarithm (base 10) of a `FLOAT`

name: sqrt
description: Returns the square root of a `FLOAT`

name: abs
description: Returns the absolute value of an `INTEGER` or `FLOAT`
examples:
MATCH (a), (e) WHERE a.name = 'Alice' AND e.name = 'Eskil'
RETURN a.age, e.age, abs(a.age - e.age)

name: ceil
description: Returns the smallest `FLOAT` that is greater than or equal to a number and equal to an `INTEGER`

name: floor
description: Returns the largest `FLOAT` that is less than or equal to a number and equal to an `INTEGER`

name: isNaN
description: Returns whether the given `INTEGER` or `FLOAT` is NaN

name: rand
description: Returns a random `FLOAT` in the range from 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive)

name: round
description: Returns the value of a rounded number, optionally using a specified precision and rounding mode

name: sign
description: Returns the signum of an `INTEGER` or `FLOAT`: 0 if the number is 0, -1 for any negative number, and 1 for any positive number

name: acos
description: Returns the arccosine of a `FLOAT` in radians

name: asin
description: Returns the arcsine of a `FLOAT` in radians

name: atan
description: Returns the arctangent of a `FLOAT` in radians

name: atan2
description: Returns the arctangent2 of a set of coordinates in radians

name: cos
description: Returns the cosine of a `FLOAT` in radians

name: cosh
description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a `FLOAT`

name: cot
description: Returns the cotangent of a `FLOAT`

name: coth
description: Returns the hyperbolic cotangent of a `FLOAT`

name: degrees
description: Converts radians to degrees

name: haversin
description: Returns half the versine of a number

name: pi
description: Returns the mathematical constant pi

name: radians
description: Converts degrees to radians

name: sin
description: Returns the sine of a `FLOAT`

name: sinh
description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a `FLOAT`

name: tan
description: Returns the tangent of a `FLOAT`

name: tanh
description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a `FLOAT`

name: Introduction
description: Predicates are boolean functions that return `true` or `false` for a given set of non-`null` input.

name: all
description: Returns true if the predicate holds for all elements in the given `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH p = (a:Person {name: 'Keanu Reeves'})-[]-{2,}()
WHERE all(x IN nodes(p) WHERE x.age < 60)
RETURN [n IN nodes(p) | n.name] AS actorsList

WITH [] as emptyList
RETURN all(i in emptyList WHERE true) as allTrue, all(i in emptyList WHERE false) as allFalse

name: allReduce
description: Returns true if, during the stepwise evaluation of a value across the elements in a given `LIST<ANY>`, the accumulated result satisfies a specified predicate at every step
signature: allReduce(accumulator = initial, stepVariable IN list \| reductionFunction, predicate)
examples:
MATCH (s) (()-[:KNOWS]-(n)){3}
WHERE allReduce(
  acc = s.age,
  node IN n | acc + node.age,
  acc < 230
)
RETURN [i IN [s] + n | i.name || " (" + toString(i.age) || ")"] AS ageSequence,
      reduce(acc = 0, node IN [s] + n | acc + node.age) AS aggregatedAges
ORDER BY aggregatedAges

MATCH path = ()-[r:KNOWS]-{3,}()
WHERE allReduce(
  span = {},
  rel IN r | { previous: span.current, current: rel.since },
  (span.previous IS NULL OR span.previous < span.current) AND span.current > 2000
)
LET people = nodes(path)
RETURN [actor IN people | actor.name] AS connectedActors,
       [rel IN r | rel.since] AS sinceYears
ORDER BY sinceYears

name: any
description: Returns true if the predicate holds for at least one element in the given `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH p = (n:Person {name: 'Keanu Reeves'})-[:KNOWS]-{3}()
WHERE any(rel IN relationships(p) WHERE rel.since < 2000)
RETURN [person IN nodes(p) | person.name] AS connectedActors,
       [rel IN relationships(p) | rel.since] AS sinceYears

WITH [] as emptyList
RETURN any(i IN emptyList WHERE true) as anyTrue, any(i IN emptyList WHERE false) as anyFalse

name: exists
description: Returns true if a match for the pattern exists in the graph
examples:
MATCH (p:Person)
RETURN p.name AS name,
       exists((p)-[:ACTED_IN]->()) AS has_acted_in_rel

name: isEmpty
description: Checks whether a `STRING`, `MAP` or `LIST<ANY>` is empty
examples:
MATCH (p:Person)
WHERE NOT isEmpty(p.nationality)
RETURN p.name, p.nationality

MATCH (p:Person)
WHERE isEmpty(p.address)
RETURN p.name AS name

name: none
description: Returns true if the predicate holds for no element in the given `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH p = (n:Person {name: 'Keanu Reeves'})-[]-{2}()
WHERE none(x IN nodes(p) WHERE x.age > 60)
RETURN [x IN nodes(p) | x.name] AS connectedActors

WITH [] as emptyList
RETURN none(i IN emptyList WHERE true) as noneTrue, none(i IN emptyList WHERE false) as noneFalse

name: single
description: Returns true if the predicate holds for exactly one of the elements in the given `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH p = (n:Person {name: 'Keanu Reeves'})-[:KNOWS]-+(b)
WHERE single(x IN [b] WHERE x.nationality = 'Northern Irish')
RETURN [person IN nodes(p) | person.name + " (" + person.nationality + ")"] AS northernIrishPaths
ORDER BY length(p)

WITH [] as emptyList
RETURN single(i IN emptyList WHERE true) as singleTrue, single(i IN emptyList WHERE false) as singleFalse

name: char_length
description: Returns the number of Unicode characters in a `STRING`

name: character_length
description: Returns the number of Unicode characters in a `STRING`

name: coalesce
description: Returns the first non-null value in a list of expressions
examples:
MATCH (a)
WHERE a.name = 'Alice'
RETURN coalesce(a.hairColor, a.eyes)

name: elementId
description: Returns the element id of a `NODE` or `RELATIONSHIP`

name: endNode
description: Returns the end `NODE` of a `RELATIONSHIP`

name: head
description: Returns the first element in a `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH (a)
WHERE a.name = 'Eskil'
RETURN a.likedColors, head(a.likedColors)

name: id
description: Returns the id of a `NODE` or `RELATIONSHIP`

name: last
description: Returns the last element in a `LIST<ANY>`
examples:
MATCH (a)
WHERE a.name = 'Eskil'
RETURN a.likedColors, last(a.likedColors)

name: length
description: Returns the length of a `PATH`
examples:
MATCH p = (a)-->(b)-->(c)
WHERE a.name = 'Alice'
RETURN length(p)

name: nullIf
description: Returns null if the two given parameters are equivalent, otherwise returns the value of the first parameter
examples:
MATCH (a)
RETURN a.name AS name, coalesce(nullIf(a.eyes, "Brown"), "Hazel") AS eyeColor

name: properties
description: Returns a `MAP` containing all the properties of a `NODE`, `RELATIONSHIP` or `MAP`

name: randomUUID
description: Generates a random UUID

name: size
description: Returns the number of items in a `LIST<ANY>`, the number of Unicode characters in a `STRING` or the dimension of a `VECTOR`
examples:
MATCH (a)
WHERE a.name = 'Alice'
RETURN size([p=(a)-->()-->() | p]) AS fof

name: startNode
description: Returns the start `NODE` of a `RELATIONSHIP`

name: timestamp
description: Returns the difference, measured in milliseconds, between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC

name: toBoolean
description: Converts a `BOOLEAN`, `STRING` or `INTEGER` value to a `BOOLEAN` value. For `INTEGER` values, 0 is defined to be false and any other `INTEGER` is defined to be true
examples: RETURN toBoolean('true'), toBoolean('not a boolean'), toBoolean(0)

name: toBooleanOrNull
description: Converts a value to a `BOOLEAN` value, or null if the value cannot be converted
examples: RETURN toBooleanOrNull('true'), toBooleanOrNull('not a boolean'), toBooleanOrNull(0), toBooleanOrNull(1.5)

name: toFloat
description: Converts a `STRING`, `INTEGER` or `FLOAT` value to a `FLOAT` value

name: toFloatOrNull
description: Converts a value to a `FLOAT` value, or null if the value cannot be converted
examples: RETURN toFloatOrNull('11.5'), toFloatOrNull('not a number'), toFloatOrNull(true)

name: toInteger
description: Converts a `BOOLEAN`, `STRING`, `INTEGER` or `FLOAT` value to an `INTEGER` value. For `BOOLEAN` values, true is defined to be 1 and false is defined to be 0
examples: RETURN toInteger('42'), toInteger('not a number'), toInteger(true)

name: toIntegerOrNull
description: Converts a value to an `INTEGER` value, or null if the value cannot be converted
examples: RETURN toIntegerOrNull('42'), toIntegerOrNull('not a number'), toIntegerOrNull(true), toIntegerOrNull(['A', 'B', 'C'])

name: type
description: Returns a `STRING` representation of the `RELATIONSHIP` type

name: valueType
description: Returns a `STRING` representation of the most precise value type that the given expression evaluates to
examples:
UNWIND ["abc", 1, 2.0, true, [date()]] AS value
RETURN valueType(value) AS result

name: point
description: Returns a 2D or 3D point object, given two or respectively three coordinate values in the Cartesian coordinate system or WGS 84 geographic coordinate system
examples: RETURN point({x: 2.3, y: 4.5, crs: 'WGS-84'}) AS point

MATCH (p:Office)
RETURN point({longitude: p.longitude, latitude: p.latitude}) AS officePoint
RETURN point({longitude: 56.7, latitude: 12.78, height: 8}) AS point

name: point.distance
description: Returns a `FLOAT` representing the distance between any two points in the same CRS
examples:
WITH
  point({x: 2.3, y: 4.5, crs: 'cartesian'}) AS p1,
  point({x: 1.1, y: 5.4, crs: 'cartesian'}) AS p2
RETURN point.distance(p1,p2) AS dist

WITH
  point({longitude: 12.78, latitude: 56.7, height: 100}) AS p1,
  point({latitude: 56.71, longitude: 12.79, height: 100}) AS p2
RETURN point.distance(p1, p2) AS dist

MATCH (t:TrainStation)-[:TRAVEL_ROUTE]->(o:Office)
WITH
  point({longitude: t.longitude, latitude: t.latitude}) AS trainPoint,
  point({longitude: o.longitude, latitude: o.latitude}) AS officePoint
RETURN round(point.distance(trainPoint, officePoint)) AS travelDistance
RETURN point.distance(null, point({longitude: 56.7, latitude: 12.78})) AS d

name: point.withinBBox
description: Returns true if the provided point is within the bounding box defined by the two provided points
examples:
WITH
  point({x: 0, y: 0, crs: 'cartesian'}) AS lowerLeft,
  point({x: 10, y: 10, crs: 'cartesian'}) AS upperRight
RETURN point.withinBBox(point({x: 5, y: 5, crs: 'cartesian'}), lowerLeft, upperRight) AS result

WITH
  point({longitude: 12.53, latitude: 55.66}) AS lowerLeft,
  point({longitude: 12.614, latitude: 55.70}) AS upperRight
MATCH (t:TrainStation)
WHERE point.withinBBox(point({longitude: t.longitude, latitude: t.latitude}), lowerLeft, upperRight)
RETURN count(t)

WITH
  point({longitude: 179, latitude: 55.66}) AS lowerLeft,
  point({longitude: -179, latitude: 55.70}) AS upperRight
RETURN point.withinBBox(point({longitude: 180, latitude: 55.66}), lowerLeft, upperRight) AS result

RETURN
  point.withinBBox(
    null,
    point({longitude: 56.7, latitude: 12.78}),
    point({longitude: 57.0, latitude: 13.0})
  ) AS in

name: btrim
description: Returns the given `STRING` with leading and trailing whitespace removed, optionally specifying a `trimCharacterString` to remove

name: left
description: Returns a `STRING` containing the specified number (`INTEGER`) of leftmost characters in the given `STRING`

name: lower
description: Returns the given `STRING` in lowercase

name: ltrim
description: Returns the given `STRING` with leading whitespace removed, optionally specifying a `trimCharacterString` to remove

name: normalize
description: Normalize a `STRING`, optionally specifying a normalization form

name: replace
description: Returns a `STRING` in which all occurrences of a specified search `STRING` in the given `STRING` have been replaced by another (specified) replacement `STRING`

name: reverse
description: Returns a `STRING` or `LIST<ANY>` in which the order of all characters or elements in the given `STRING` or `LIST<ANY>` have been reversed

name: right
description: Returns a `STRING` containing the specified number of rightmost characters in the given `STRING`

name: rtrim
description: Returns the given `STRING` with trailing whitespace characters to remove, optionally specifying a `trimCharacterString` of characters to remove

name: split
description: Returns a `LIST<STRING>` resulting from the splitting of the given `STRING` around matches of the given delimiter(s)

name: substring
description: Returns a substring of a given `length` from the given `STRING`, beginning with a 0-based index start

name: toLower
description: Returns the given `STRING` in lowercase

name: toString
description: Converts an `INTEGER`, `FLOAT`, `BOOLEAN`, `POINT` or temporal type (i.e. `DATE`, `ZONED TIME`, `LOCAL TIME`, `ZONED DATETIME`, `LOCAL DATETIME` or `DURATION`) value to a `STRING`
examples:
RETURN
  toString(11.5),
  toString('already a string'),
  toString(true),
  toString(date({year: 1984, month: 10, day: 11})) AS dateString,
  toString(datetime({year: 1984, month: 10, day: 11, hour: 12, minute: 31, second: 14, millisecond: 341, timezone: 'Europe/Stockholm'})) AS datetimeString,
  toString(duration({minutes: 12, seconds: -60})) AS durationString

name: toStringOrNull
description: Converts an `INTEGER`, `FLOAT`, `BOOLEAN`, `POINT` or temporal type (i.e. `DATE`, `ZONED TIME`, `LOCAL TIME`, `ZONED DATETIME`, `LOCAL DATETIME` or `DURATION`) value to a `STRING`, or null if the value cannot be converted
examples:
RETURN toStringOrNull(11.5),
toStringOrNull('already a string'),
toStringOrNull(true),
toStringOrNull(date({year: 1984, month: 10, day: 11})) AS dateString,
toStringOrNull(datetime({year: 1984, month: 10, day: 11, hour: 12, minute: 31, second: 14, millisecond: 341, timezone: 'Europe/Stockholm'})) AS datetimeString,
toStringOrNull(duration({minutes: 12, seconds: -60})) AS durationString,
toStringOrNull(['A', 'B', 'C']) AS list

name: toUpper
description: Returns the given `STRING` in uppercase

name: trim
description: Returns the given `STRING` with leading and/or trailing `trimCharacterString` removed

name: upper
description: Returns the given `STRING` in uppercase

name: vector
description: Constructs a xref:values-and-types/vector.adoc[`VECTOR`] value
examples:
RETURN vector(null, 3, FLOAT32) AS nullVectorValue,
       vector([1, 2, 3], null, INTEGER8) AS nullDimension

name: vector.similarity.cosine
description: Returns a `FLOAT` representing the similarity between the argument vectors based on their cosine

name: vector.similarity.euclidean
description: Returns a `FLOAT` representing the similarity between the argument vectors based on their Euclidean distance
examples:
CREATE
  (:Node { id: 1, vector: vector([1.0, 4.0, 2.0], 3, FLOAT32) }),
  (:Node { id: 2, vector: vector([3.0, -2.0, 1.0], 3, FLOAT32) }),
  (:Node { id: 3, vector: vector([2.0, 8.0, 3.0], 3, FLOAT32) });

MATCH (node:Node)
WITH node, vector.similarity.euclidean($query, node.vector) AS score
RETURN node, score
ORDER BY score DESCENDING
LIMIT 2

name: vector_dimension_count
description: Returns the dimension of a `VECTOR`

name: vector_distance
description: Returns a `FLOAT` representing the distance between the two vector values based on the selected `vectorDistanceMetric` algorithm
examples: RETURN vector_distance(vector([1, 2, 3], 3, INTEGER8), vector([1, 2, 4], 3, INTEGER8), COSINE) AS distance
RETURN vector_distance(vector([1.0, 5.0, 3.0, 6.7], 4, FLOAT32), vector([5.0, 2.5, 3.1, 9.0], 4, FLOAT32), EUCLIDEAN)

name: vector_norm
description: Returns a `FLOAT` representing the distance between the given vector and an origin vector, which is a vector with the same dimension with all coordinates set to zero, calculated using the specified `vectorDistanceMetric`
examples: RETURN vector_norm(vector([1.0, 5.0, 3.0, 6.7], 4, FLOAT32), EUCLIDEAN) AS norm
RETURN vector_norm(vector([1.0, 5.0, 3.0, 6.7], 4, FLOAT32), MANHATTAN) AS norm

name: apoc.path.expandConfig
description: Configurable path expansion from start node(s) with relationship/label filters, min/max depth, and uniqueness constraints
signature: apoc.path.expandConfig(startNode :: NODE | LIST<NODE>, config :: MAP) :: PATH
examples:
MATCH (start:Person {name: $name})
CALL apoc.path.expandConfig(start, {
  relationshipFilter: 'KNOWS|WORKS_WITH>',
  labelFilter: '+Employee|/Manager',
  minLevel: 1,
  maxLevel: 4,
  uniqueness: 'NODE_GLOBAL'
}) YIELD path
RETURN path

name: apoc.path.subgraphAll
description: Extract complete subgraph (nodes and relationships) within a given distance from start node(s)
signature: apoc.path.subgraphAll(startNode :: NODE | LIST<NODE>, config :: MAP) :: (nodes :: LIST<NODE>, relationships :: LIST<RELATIONSHIP>)
examples:
MATCH (start:Company {name: $company})
CALL apoc.path.subgraphAll(start, {
  maxLevel: 3,
  relationshipFilter: 'OWNS>|SUBSIDIARY_OF>|PARTNERS_WITH',
  labelFilter: '+Company|+Division'
}) YIELD nodes, relationships
RETURN nodes, relationships

name: apoc.path.spanningTree
description: Return a spanning tree from start node(s) with configurable relationship/label filters and depth
signature: apoc.path.spanningTree(startNode :: NODE | LIST<NODE>, config :: MAP) :: PATH
examples:
MATCH (root:Department {name: $dept})
CALL apoc.path.spanningTree(root, {
  relationshipFilter: 'REPORTS_TO>|MANAGES>',
  labelFilter: '+Employee',
  maxLevel: 5
}) YIELD path
RETURN path

name: apoc.coll.toSet
description: Convert a list to a deduplicated set, removing duplicate values
examples:
MATCH (p:Person)-[:TAGGED]->(t:Tag)
WITH p, collect(t.name) AS allTags
RETURN p.name, apoc.coll.toSet(allTags) AS uniqueTags

name: apoc.text.join
description: Join a list of strings with a specified separator
examples:
MATCH (p:Person)-[:HAS_SKILL]->(s:Skill)
WITH p, collect(s.name) AS skills
RETURN p.name, apoc.text.join(skills, ', ') AS skillList

name: gds.graph.project
description: Project an in-memory named graph from the Neo4j database for GDS algorithm execution
signature: CALL gds.graph.project(graphName :: STRING, nodeProjection :: STRING | LIST<STRING> | MAP, relationshipProjection :: STRING | LIST<STRING> | MAP, configuration :: MAP) YIELD graphName, nodeCount, relationshipCount, projectMillis
returns: graphName :: STRING, nodeCount :: INTEGER, relationshipCount :: INTEGER, projectMillis :: INTEGER

name: gds.pageRank.stream
description: Stream PageRank scores for each node in the projected graph, useful for influence and authority detection
signature: CALL gds.pageRank.stream(graphName :: STRING, configuration :: MAP) YIELD nodeId, score
examples:
CALL gds.pageRank.stream('social-graph', {
  maxIterations: 20,
  dampingFactor: 0.85
}) YIELD nodeId, score
RETURN gds.util.asNode(nodeId).name AS name, score
ORDER BY score DESC
LIMIT 10

name: gds.louvain.stream
description: Stream community IDs assigned by the Louvain modularity optimization algorithm for community detection
signature: CALL gds.louvain.stream(graphName :: STRING, configuration :: MAP) YIELD nodeId, communityId, intermediateCommunityIds
returns: nodeId :: INTEGER, communityId :: INTEGER, intermediateCommunityIds :: LIST<INTEGER>

name: gds.betweenness.stream
description: Stream betweenness centrality scores for each node, identifying bottlenecks and bridge nodes in the graph
signature: CALL gds.betweenness.stream(graphName :: STRING, configuration :: MAP) YIELD nodeId, score

name: gds.nodeSimilarity.stream
description: Stream pairs of nodes with their Jaccard or overlap similarity score based on shared neighbors
signature: CALL gds.nodeSimilarity.stream(graphName :: STRING, configuration :: MAP) YIELD node1, node2, similarity
returns: node1 :: INTEGER, node2 :: INTEGER, similarity :: FLOAT
examples:
CALL gds.nodeSimilarity.stream('product-graph', {
  topK: 5,
  similarityCutoff: 0.3
}) YIELD node1, node2, similarity
RETURN gds.util.asNode(node1).name AS from,
       gds.util.asNode(node2).name AS to,
       similarity
ORDER BY similarity DESC

name: gds.shortestPath.dijkstra.stream
description: Stream the weighted shortest path between a source and target node using Dijkstra's algorithm
signature: CALL gds.shortestPath.dijkstra.stream(graphName :: STRING, configuration :: MAP) YIELD index, sourceNode, targetNode, totalCost, nodeIds, costs, path
returns: index :: INTEGER, sourceNode :: INTEGER, targetNode :: INTEGER, totalCost :: FLOAT, nodeIds :: LIST<INTEGER>, costs :: LIST<FLOAT>, path :: PATH
examples:
MATCH (source:City {name: $from}), (target:City {name: $to})
CALL gds.shortestPath.dijkstra.stream('transport-graph', {
  sourceNode: source,
  targetNode: target,
  relationshipWeightProperty: 'distance'
}) YIELD totalCost, nodeIds, costs
RETURN totalCost,
       [nodeId IN nodeIds | gds.util.asNode(nodeId).name] AS route,
       costs
